history.content:
Several of my friends were given start dates that ranged from 2-6 months out, so there is no shame in taking a small break. I don't think people should compare standards between different fields as the tech industry seems to be a little more relaxed and understanding of their employees. I had the option of either starting ASAP or taking a few months off and I chose starting immediately just to jump right in. 

In short, for tech, I don't think it matters at all, employers are going to look at you for what you have accomplished with your side projects, employment, and personality, not that you wanted to take a break between school and full time work.

I went home for break and asked my siblings if I should:

a) start full time work right after graduation

b) start full time work after a few months and travel

c) start full time work after a few months and relax a bit, code some side projects, and network

and they pretty much yelled at me lol and said i'm stupid to not start immediately and that it will look "terrible" on my resume with the 2-3 month gap between graduation and full time. None of them are in the tech industry.

I was wondering if anyone had any insight on this. Thanks!
history.subject: Time Between Graduating and Starting Work?
